summary: This document outlines the background, assets, and philanthropic activities of Jeffrey Epstein, including his estimated net worth and properties owned. It also details his criminal charges related to soliciting underage prostitution and his subsequent registration as a sex offender.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in this document, with details about his wealth, properties, business ventures, and criminal charges outlined.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as a well-known client of Epstein's financial management firm, J. Epstein & Co.

connections.description: Leslie Wexner is a prominent client of Jeffrey Epstein's financial management firm, indicating a professional relationship.

events.title: Criminal Charges
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with soliciting underage prostitution and served 13 months of an 18-month sentence.

events.title: Foundation Established
events.description: The Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation was established to fund scientific research and education.

events.title: Donation to Harvard
events.description: Epstein donated $30 million to Harvard University to establish the Program for Evolutionary Dynamics.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's estimated net worth is $2 billion.
He owns multiple properties including a townhouse in Manhattan and a villa in Palm Beach.
Epstein was charged with soliciting underage prostitution in 2008 and served 13 months in prison.
He established the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation in 2000 to fund scientific research.
Epstein donated $30 million to Harvard University in 2003 for a program studying evolutionary dynamics.
